fruit

Class FruitList

  • java.lang.Object
    • fruit.FruitList

  • public class FruitList
extends java.lang.Object
    Read a file and find the listed fruits, and their description, and save them in a array named fruitList, and display them. Find the maximum protein, calorie and fiber. Find if x fruitList is equal to y fruitList. Assignment 1_B Date : 2017-01-30

    • Constructor Detail

      • FruitList

        public FruitList()
        Initializes a newly created FruitList object of default size. Constructor to create a Fruit array of default size and make fruitCount = 0. Default size = 10 as previously shown. Do same thing as other constructor with cap = to DEFAULT_SIZE.

      • FruitList

        public FruitList(int cap)
        Initializes a newly created FruitList object of a given capacity. Constructor to create a Fruit array of size 'cap'and make fruitCount = 0. This method is used to make the first constructor.
        Parameters:
        cap - = size of the FruitList array to be constructed.

    • Method Detail

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Find the total size of the array given. Found by .length of the fruitList.
        Returns:
        the size of the array.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Finds if the array is empty.
        Returns:
        True if fruitCount is equal to 0.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Finds if the array is full. Method capacity used to find the size of the array.
        Returns:
        True if fruitCount is equal to the size of the array.

      • addToEnd

        public void addToEnd(Fruit f)
        Add a fruit to the end of a fruitList. If the list is full, a error message will be shown and method returned, the isFull method used here. Else add 1 to the fruitCount and at the Fruit to the end of the list using the array.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fruit given to be added at the end of a fruitList.

      • addToFront

        public void addToFront(Fruit f)
        Add a fruit to the front of a fruitList. If the list is full, a error message will be shown and method returned, the isFull method used here. A loop is created to make all the fruits move by one in the fruitList. Loop ends when the fruitCount is equal to 0. Add given fruit f to fruitCount 0 'position' in fruitList and 1 to fruitCount.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fruit given to be added at the front of a fruitList.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Method to load the given file, with the fruitList. If the file does not exist return an error message and exit. Else create a Scanner named fileScan which scans the file given by the user. Read files and save Name, portionSize, protein, calories and fibers. Create a fruit with found info and add to the end of the frutiList if list is not full, using addToEnd method. If list is full return error message.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the name of the file with the fruitList given by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - File reading.

      • maxCalorie

        public Fruit maxCalorie()
        Find the Fruit with maximum amount of calorie. Assume that the first fruit as the maximum amount calories. Does a loop to find if any other Fruit as a higher calorie value. If found make that the maxPos.
        Returns:
        the Fruit with the maximum Calorie value.

      • minCalorie

        public Fruit minCalorie()
        Find the Fruit with minimum amount of calorie. Assume that the first fruit as the minimum amount calories. Does a loop to find if any other Fruit as a lower calorie value. If found make that the minPos.
        Returns:
        the Fruit with the minimum Calorie value.

      • maxProtein

        public Fruit maxProtein()
        Find the Fruit with maximum amount of Protein. Assume that the first fruit as the maximum amount Protein. Does a loop to find if any other Fruit as a higher Protein value. If found make that the maxPos.
        Returns:
        the Fruit with the maximum Protein value.

      • totalProtein

        public double totalProtein()
        Find the total protein level of all fruits from the list combined. Add the protein value of each fruit to 'totalP' using the getProtein method.
        Returns:
        value of totalProtein

      • totalCalorie

        public double totalCalorie()
        Find the total calorie level of all fruits from the list combined. Add the calorie value of each fruit to 'totalC' using the getCalories method.
        Returns:
        value of totalCalories

        Find the total fiber level of all fruits from the list combined. Add the fiber value of each fruit to 'totalF' using the getFibers method.

        value of totalFibers
